pr_title: Expose upsert/inject information for SQL tables

timeline.message: Merge Pojo & Primitive upsert descriptor into Java one
Add equals() & hashCode() to upsert descriptors

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into upserts

# Conflicts:
#	hazelcast-sql/src/test/java/com/hazelcast/sql/impl/expression/ExpressionTestBase.java
#	hazelcast/src/main/java/com/hazelcast/sql/impl/schema/map/AbstractMapTable.java
#	hazelcast/src/main/java/com/hazelcast/sql/impl/schema/map/PartitionedMapTable.java

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into upserts

# Conflicts:
#	hazelcast/src/main/java/com/hazelcast/sql/impl/SqlDataSerializerHook.java

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer something more pointing to the use, such as keyResolverPluginData
timeline.author: viliam-durina

timeline.bodyText:
Minor comment - the name is not very specific. I would name it something like JetMapMetadataResolver or alike, to highlight that is:

Comes from Jet
Deals with metadata
timeline.author: devozerov

timeline.bodyText:
Also minor comment.
In the resolver's code, you either pass here Class of ClassDefinition as the first argument. It is ok from IMDG perspective, but are you ok with a necessity of casts inside Jet implementation?
If you leave the interface as is, I would propose adding JavaDoc about expected arguments.

replies.author: gierlachg

replies.bodyText:
They both OK from the IMDG perspective. The question is - what is better for Jet.
The interface you proposed in the comment looks good to me - it is clean and simple.
replies.author: devozerov
